Articles.Content: Mine seems to be getting dangerously high usage a lot sooner than in 1.0.2. I'm using the same set of mods but of course one of them could be leaking memory now, whereas it didn't do it in its 1.0.2 version, but still, I'm curious.
It's different for me, now using even more Mods and I can play for 4 hours straight without any issue. Also I tend to feel more fps but this might be subjective
I have the same number of mods from 1.0.2 but yet I haven't had a single memory crash in 1.0.4. This used to happen every hour or so. It might be because of the temperature gauge fix though.

I've got about 20 mods, including Adobe minor parts packs. Played for about six hours today, 0 problems 1.0.4 is a complete success for me. No unexpected rocket flippung. Later tonight I suspect to launch some ssto's if my campaign continues on schedule.

I have only minor mods like Chatterer, KER, Kerbal Alarm clock and Clamshell fairings and yet the memory usage in 1.0.4 is rocketing to the ceiling.

It definitely improved between 0.90.0 and 1.0 but has gotten worse with every update since...

I use a lot of mods but was sitting about 2.8-3.2GB usage with OpenGL in 1.0.2. Currently with 1.0.4 I get the 99.9% complete loading bar and then crash due to running out of memory. I also updated several mods to coincide with the new version so it could be a combination of the update as well as mods that are for various versions. KSP could also have been peaking at 3.9GB in 1.0.2 for all I know and then immediately stepping back under 3, there appears to be a threshold at the end of loading where the memory skyrockets before leveling out again.

I feel playing KSP has taxed my memory a great deal. I mean, I keep forgetting about adding antennae and ladders and stuff, you would think I would remember those by nowÃ¢â‚¬Â¦
